parameters.subject: Re: {{ $json.name.split(' ')[0] }} - How We Beat The Market By 37.5%
parameters.message:
=

Hi {{ $json.name.split(' ')[0] }},

Following up on my previous email about our AQUA strategy's 76% Year 1 returns.

I wanted to share the 3 core principles that drove this performance:

1. Market Regime Detection
We identify bull, bear, high volatility, and trending markets using 27 quantitative indicators. When 18+ align, we confirm the regime and adjust allocation accordingly.

2. Factor Rotation
We track 6 primary factors (Value, Momentum, Quality, Low Volatility, Size, Growth). Top 2-3 factors get maximum allocation. Underperforming factors reduced to zero.

3. Dynamic Asset Allocation
Unlike traditional 60-40 portfolios, AQUA ranges from 20% to 95% equity based on opportunity. In March 2020 crash, we went 90% equity. In Oct 2021 euphoria, we reduced to 35%.

The Result?
76% return with LOWER volatility than the benchmark. Better returns with better sleep.

Would you like to see how this approach fits your portfolio?

Book a 30-Min Portfolio Review

Best regards,
Siddharth Vora

Past performance does not guarantee future results. AQUA's 76% return is historical and may not be replicated. Investments in PMS involve risks including loss of principal. SEBI registered: INP000007021.

parameters.subject: ={{ $json.name.split(' ')[0] }} - Client Case Study: ₹5 Cr → ₹8.8 Cr in 12 Months
parameters.message:
=

Hi {{ $json.name.split(' ')[0] }},

I wanted to share a real client story (anonymized for privacy).

Profile: {{ $json.title }}, Manufacturing Industry, Age 48
Portfolio Size: ₹5 Crore
Goal: Beat market returns, 5-year horizon
Risk Appetite: Moderate-High

The Journey:

  • Jan 2024: Invested ₹5 Cr in AQUA strategy
  • Q1 2024: Portfolio: ₹6.1 Cr (+22%)
  • Q2 2024: Portfolio: ₹7.3 Cr (+46%)
  • Q3 2024: Portfolio: ₹8.0 Cr (+60%)
  • Dec 2024: Portfolio: ₹8.8 Cr (+76%)

What Made The Difference?

Our systematic approach removed emotion from investing. When markets crashed in March, he stayed invested (because data said so). When euphoria peaked in October, we reduced equity exposure (again, data-driven).

His Words:
"For the first time in 20 years of investing, I'm not checking my portfolio daily. I trust the system, and the results speak for themselves."

Could this work for you?

Let's Discuss Your Portfolio

Best regards,
Siddharth Vora

Case study is anonymized. Individual results may vary. Past performance does not guarantee future results. SEBI registered: INP000007021.

parameters.subject: ={{ $json.name.split(' ')[0] }} - Common Objection: "But 2% Fees Are High"
parameters.message:
=

Hi {{ $json.name.split(' ')[0] }},

Many HNIs ask me: "Why pay 2% when index funds charge 0.1%?"

It's a valid question. Let me put it in perspective:

₹1 Crore invested over 5 years:

Strategy Return Fees Final Value
Index Fund 12% 0.1% ₹1.75 Cr
AQUA Strategy 20% 2% ₹2.33 Cr

The difference: ₹58 lakh more - even after paying higher fees.

The real question isn't "What are the fees?"
It's "What are the NET returns after fees?"

Index funds match the market at low cost.
AQUA aims to beat the market significantly.

Your Choice:

  • Pay 0.1% fees, get market returns (12%)
  • Pay 2% fees, get alpha returns (20%+)

Which creates more wealth?

Let's Calculate Your Potential

Best regards,
Siddharth Vora

Hypothetical example for illustration. Actual returns may vary. Past performance (20% avg) does not guarantee future results. SEBI registered: INP000007021.

But here's what I haven't shared yet: How this specifically applies to YOUR portfolio.

Every HNI's situation is unique:

  • Different risk tolerance

That's why I'm personally inviting you to a 30-minute portfolio review call.

In this call, I'll:

No sales pitch. No pressure. Just insights.

But if you see the potential - and most HNIs do - we can discuss next steps.

Siddharth Vora
